posts.description: Earlier this week, I read a really interesting piece on 3 things that need to be done to save the web. The first observation was that "weâ€™ve lost control of our personal data" and the author went on to observe the following: As our data is then held in

posts.message:
Please help, i am searching for getting mac address or any unique identifier from each device (specially for mobiles) for a web app , i read more than 100 articles without getting a useful solution , all the mentioned technique are easily abused(fingerprint-cookies jar-canavas) , i read also about ssl client certificates , but they weren't the best for me ,  the main purpose is to track user browser with unique identifier , so if he logged with the correct login credentials but from different device , i can catch him and report that
So please help if you can.

it is normal to apply into more than 200 companies in Europe that you see their job posts match your skills  , and get replies from only 15  , they told you that your CV don't pass the initial  screening or they decided to continue with other candidates  ? . this is my CV https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B3TrUbovVLbgZzc2emdmUmFnZGs/view
Do you have a raspberry pi? what do you use it for?
